chapter.title: Conversions/exporting
chapter.para: The conversions allows you to transform the format of a bibliographic file to another. The exporting process allows you to export all of a part of the PMB database

sect1.title: File formats
sect1.para: PMB is able to convert or export to and from various file formats.

marc iso 2709 : notices encoded in one of the MARC formats according to the ISO standard, this includes UNIMARC ISO 2709 files but also files in MARC21, USMARC ... This file format is not editable with a standard text editor.
html marc : notices in one of the MARC formats translated in HTML to be displayed on a web browser.
pmb xml marc : notices in one of the MARC formats translated in XML, according to PMB DTD, this includes the Unimarc files in PMB XML but also the files in MARC21, USMARC...
text : notices that you can edit with a standard text editor.
Memo notices BCDI : notices coming from a BCDI export.
RTF : notices list in Rich Text Format. It's a list of book and their authors. This allows for example to edit a new book list.

sect1.title: External files conversion
sect1.para: PMB allows you to convert bibliographic files.

listitem.para: Click on the browse button to select one file on your hard disk. This file will then be uploaded on the server. Caution : the size of the uploaded file may be limited by your PHP configuration.
You can also upload yourself the file on the server. You must then put it in the temp directory and give it the name convert.fic

sect1.para: You must afterwards choose the conversion type :

listitem.para: memo notices bcdi -> pmb xml unimarc

sect1.para: Once the conversion is started, a progress bar shows the degree of achievement of the conversion process.
When the conversion ends, the file created by the conversion process is prompted for download.

sect1.title: PMB database export
sect1.para: This feature allows you to export all of a part of your data in various formats. Exporting data in UNIMARC format enables you to reuse the PMB data in another program.

step.para: Select the file format. For more details, see .
Then select the owner of the items to be exported. This allows, for a city library for example, to export a file in RTF format of all items in the Regional library fund.

Afterwards select on or more document types corresponding to the exported items. By default, no document type is selected, to select one, click on a document type. To select several document types, press the Cttrl key and click on the various documents types.
Finally, select one or more status. To select several status, press the Ctrl key and click on the various status.
If you wan preserve your items informations, for example, if you transfer your fund to another site, if you make a donation after a sort, click on preserve items informations in 995 label.
